title: Somers' D
summary: In statistics, Somers’ D, sometimes incorrectly referred to as Somer’s D, is a measure of ordinal association between two possibly dependent random variables X and Y. Somers’ D takes values between − 1 {\displaystyle -1} when all pairs of the variables disagree and 1 {\displaystyle 1} when all pairs of the variables agree. Somers’ D is named after Robert H. Somers, who proposed it in 1962.[1]
